description: ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY SIDE AND REAR WRAPAROUND EXTENSION AND ERECTION OF A HIP TO GABLE AND REAR ROOF EXTENSION WITH A JULIETTE BALCONY AND INSTALLATION OF 1 x ROOFLIGHT TO FRONT ROOF SLOPE
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 001, 003, 007( 12/4/2013), 008 (9/4/2013) & 009 (9/4/2013).

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified on the plans and in the email sent 25th April 2013 unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no window, or other opening other than those expressly authorised by this permission shall be constructed in the north facing flank wall of the rear extension without planning permission first being obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - REASON FOR APPROVAL.
The proposed single storey rear and side extension, and the hip to gable and rear roof extension are acceptable in terms of visual and residential amenity. The proposal accords with the Council's Core Strategy, Adopted Unitary Development Plan and London Plan Policies. The policies listed below were relevant to the determination of this proposal.
Merton LDF Core Planning Strategy (2011) CS14 (Design)
Merton Unitary Development Plan (2003) BE15 (New buildings and extensions), BE23 (Alterations and extensions to buildings).
BE24 (Roof extensions and dormer windows).

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE 
The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link:	
http://www.communities.gov.uk/documents/planningandbuilding/pdf/133214.pdf

Condition : 7 - In accordance with paragraphs 186 and 187 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by: Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome. As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application. In this instance: The applicant was offered the opportunity to submit amended plans in order to make the proposal acceptable in planning terms.
